page.title: 14Safety at the Crossroads
page.content:
The transfer of the infants children from their class at Great Ryburgh to the Annexe at Stibbard in September 1981 focussed local concern on the hazardous crossroads which the school bus had to negotiate each day. Representation was made by the school's Headteacher, his governors, the parish councils of Great Ryburgh and Stibbard to the local authority for improvements to visibility at the crossroads, partly by the removal of a large tree on the south west corner. A serious motor accident at the crossroads in which the owner of Ryburgh Stores (not the present owner) was badly injured finally precipitated the removal of the tree with the agreement of the landowner, Thomas Cook Esq.
{(See also pages 3 and 5)
